column1: Uray (Russian: Ура́й) is a town in  Khanty–Mansi Autonomous Okrug
column2: located on the Konda River 350 kilometers (220 mi) from Khanty-Mansiysk. Population: 39

column1: It was founded as a settlement for oil field workers. It was granted town status in 1965.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: it is incorporated as the town of okrug significance of Uray—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column3: the town of okrug significance of Uray is incorporated as Uray Urban Okrug.

column1: Uray is the organizational center of the oil-extracting region. In 1960
column2: the first oil field in Siberia—the Shaimskoye field—opened here). Uray is the starting point of the Shaim–Tyumen oilpipe line. TPP Uraуneftegaz OOO "LUKoil- Zapadnaya Sibir" oil reprocessor plant is located in Uray.

column1: Other Uray's industries include food industry and housebuilding.
The town is served by the Uray Airport.
